org.svvrl.goal.core.aut
Class State

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractEditable
      org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.AutomatonComponent
          org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.GraphicComponent
              org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.State
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.EventListener, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AltConnector, AltState, FSAState, GameState
public class State
extends GraphicComponent

A state contains a unique identifier, a name, a label, and some other properties. Two states are equal if they have the same ID.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai
See Also:

getPosition

public java.awt.Point getPosition()

Returns:

getIdentityName

public java.lang.String getIdentityName()
Returns the name for identifying states. The name is the state prefix plus the state ID where the state prefix can be set in the user preference.

Returns:
the name for identifying states

getDisplayName

public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
Returns the name for display. If the custom name is not set, a default name (a prefix plus the state's ID) will be returned.

Returns:
the name of this state for display
